Swapped the ordering of searching for bold/underline/invert vs. colours so that ^B^B (or similar) can be used to separate a colour code from a number that should be coloured (for those of us - like me until five minutes ago - who hadn't thought of zero-padding single-digit colour codes). This brings QuasselDroid's behaviour in line with the official Quassel client.

Removed developer-specific paths from the .classpath file and renamed it as .classpath.dist, adding .classpath to the ignore list so that the project can be built successfully regardless of platform and environment, and changing the .classpath to suit the developer's own environment won't cause problems for other developers if the .classpath is accidentally committed (just remember to make any actually-global .classpath changes in the .classpath.dist file as well!). This issue was also making it even more difficult to issue pull requests from forks.
Fixed highlights so that action messages (/me) will trigger highlights.

Update CoreConnection.java and CoreInfo.java to work properly with the latest updates to the Quassel core.
This removes code to handle several messages from the core that were never used in Quassel itself and have been removed from the latest core. It also removes the core version checking, which is pointless because of the protocol version check.

Remove unneeded code to process commands beginning with '/', as this is done by the core.
This additionally fixes the bug reported by Ashfire908 where messages escaped with '//' would be erroneously converted to all caps.

Do not assign the network name to network status buffers.
This fixes Issue #98 (https://github.com/sandsmark/QuasselDroid/issues/98) which was caused by the fact that the Quassel core decides whether or not to insert a message into a buffer (and therefore create a new buffer if it does not exist) by whether the buffer name is the empty string.  The proper Quassel client always keeps the buffer name for status buffers set to the empty string, so QuasselDroid should too.

Fix the nick list alphabetization problem.
Before, new nicks were always added to the nick list at the bottom.  Now, the list is sorted after inserting each nick.

Fix text coloring of queries in the buffer list.
This patch sets the status of query buffers based on whether or not the user is present, away, or gone.  The old code only set the color if the user was Gone, but this didn't even work because the regular color-picking code overrode the query-specific code.  Additionally, the old code would not have matched the selected theme, had it worked at all.

Fix handling of Topic messages.
Handle Topic messages in ChatFragment and assign them the same formatting as in the regular Quassel client.

Make Quit messages have the Quit text color for messages and nicks.
Looks like someone copy-pasted and forgot to change one of the instances.
Add '[]' around the nick in NOTICE messages to match the formatting used by regular Quassel.
Properly parse, format, and display netsplit messages.

Fix crashes occurring after deleting a buffer.
The issue was that deleted buffers were still left being displayed in the interface, so any attempt to delete a buffer was causing app crashing.  This switches the displayed buffer to an empty buffer upon deleting a buffer, which prevents the crashes.
